Title:
Mortierella sugadairana, a new homothallic species related to
the firstly described heterothallic species in the genus
Abstract:
A new species, Mortierella sugadairana, is described for a
fungus forming homothallic zygospores with a club-shaped macrosuspensor
and a microsuspensor originating from the macrosuspensor. The species
was isolated from cool regions in Japan and morphologically and
phylogenetically close to a heterothallic species M. parvispora, which
is the first species reported as a heterothallic species in the genus.
Mycelial growth of the species was limited at 30 Â°C, whereas two
isolates of M. parvispora can grow. This may indicate that the species
and M. parvispora adapted to different climates from a common ancestor
involving differentiation of the manner of reproduction.
